block.p: SOUTHERN CO., Atlanta, a power producer, said it planned to build a natural-gas-fired power plant in southwestern Michigan. The cost was not disclosed.

DELPHI AUTOMOTIVE SYSTEMS CORP., Troy, Mich., the largest auto-parts maker, agreed to buy more interior and engine parts from the closely held Regal Plastics Co., Roseville, Mich., to increase the variety of door handles and other parts it offers. Terms were not disclosed.

CYRK INC., Gloucester, Mass., a designer of consumer brand promotions, said it planned to cut 15 percent of its work force, about 175 employees, to reduce annual costs by as much as $15 million.
CELANESE A.G., Frankfurt, the industrial chemicals maker, said it would buy back up to 10 percent of its shares by Nov. 9, 2001. The company has 55.9 million shares outstanding.
